alert.note: Alert for Orange; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:10AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN ORANGE AND NORTHERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 AM EDT... At 910 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Bedford, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Salem, Orleans, Campbellsburg, Little York, Saltillo, Kossuth, Leipsic, Smedley, Claysville and Hitchcock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
